content:
A solution of HL (0.05 mmol) and 4bpy (0.05 mmol) in EtOH (10 mL) in the presence of excess 2,6-dimethylpyridine (ca. 0.05 mL for adjusting the pH to basic condition) was carefully layered on the top of an H2O solution (15 mL) of Zn(NO3)2·6H2O (0.05 mmol) in a test tube. Colorless single crystals suitable for X-ray analysis appeared at the tube wall after ca. 1 month at room temperature. Yield: ca. 30% based on HL. Anal. Calcd (%) for C44H46N2O6Zn: C, 69.3; H, 6.1; N, 3.7; found (%): C, 68.9; H, 6.4; N, 3.4. IR (KBr pellet, cm−1): 3,642s(br), 3,025m, 1,957w, 1,599s, 1,568s, 1,494m, 1,449m, 1,409s, 1,310m, 1,220m, 1,086w, 1,063m, 1,002w, 967w, 902w, 853w, 806s, 749m, 703s, 625m, 611m, 587w, 543w, 473w.

Preparation of [Co(<bold>L</bold>)<sub>2</sub>(4bpy) EtOH)<sub>2</sub>]<sub>∞</sub> (<bold>2</bold>)

The same procedure as that for 1 was used for this complex except that Zn(NO3)2·6H2O was replaced by Co(NO3)2·6H2O. Light red single crystals suitable for X-ray analysis appeared at the tube wall after ca. 1 month at room temperature. Yield: ca. 30% based on HL. Anal. Calcd (%) for C44H46N2O6Co: C, 69.7; H, 6.1; N, 3.7; found (%): C, 70.0; H, 6.5; N, 3.5. IR (KBr pellet, cm−1): 3,418s(br), 3,237w, 2,971w, 2,038w, 1,640s, 1,617s, 1,561w, 1,453s, 1,217m, 1,140m, 1,060m, 1031m, 879w, 849m, 822w, 811w, 749w, 612s, 494w.

Preparation of [Ni(<bold>L</bold>)<sub>2</sub>(4bpy)(EtOH)<sub>2</sub>]<sub>∞</sub> (<bold>3</bold>)

The same procedure as that for 1 was used for this complex except that Zn(NO3)2·6H2O was replaced by Ni(Ac)2·4H2O. Green single crystals suitable for X-ray analysis appeared at the tube wall after ca. 1 month at room temperature Yield: ca. 40% based on HL. Anal. Calcd (%) for C44H46N2O6Ni: C, 69.8; H, 6.1; N, 3.7; found (%): C, 70.0; H, 6.4; N, 3.4. IR (KBr pellet, cm−1): 3,472s(br), 3,237w, 2,511w, 2,038w, 1,688w, 1,640s, 1,618s, 1,564w, 1,456s, 1,132m, 1,029w, 879w, 848m, 816w, 617s.

Preparation of [Cu(<bold>L</bold>)<sub>2</sub>(4bpy)(H<sub>2</sub>O)]<sub>∞</sub> (<bold>4</bold>)

The same procedure as that for 1 was used for this complex except that Zn(NO3)2·6H2O was replaced by CuSO4·5H2O. Light blue single crystals suitable for X-ray analysis appeared at the tube wall after ca. 1 month at room temperature. Yield: ca. 30% based on HL. Anal. Calcd (%) for C40H36N2O5Cu: C, 69.9; H, 5.3; N, 4.1; found (%): C, 69.7; H, 5.5; N, 4.4. IR (KBr pellet, cm−1): 3,464s(br), 1,604s, 1,450s, 1,402s, 1,303w, 1,221m, 1,151m, 1,066m, 1,032m, 971w, 900w, 879w, 849m, 810m, 756w, 734w, 705w, 691m, 609m, 483w.
clean_text:
Preparation of [Zn(L)2(4bpy)(EtOH)2]∞ (1)

A solution of HL (0.05 mmol) and 4bpy (0.05 mmol) in EtOH (10 mL) in the presence of excess 2,6-dimethylpyridine (ca. 0.05 mL for adjusting the pH to basic condition) was carefully layered on the top of an H2O solution (15 mL) of Zn(NO3)2⋅6H2O (0.05 mmol) in a test tube. Colorless single crystals suitable for X-ray analysis appeared at the tube wall after ca. 1 month at room temperature. Yield: ca. 30% based on HL. Anal. Calcd (%) for C44H46N2O6Zn: C, 69.3; H, 6.1; N, 3.7; found (%): C, 68.9; H, 6.4; N, 3.4. IR (KBr pellet, cm-1): 3,642s(br), 3,025m, 1,957w, 1,599s, 1,568s, 1,494m, 1,449m, 1,409s, 1,310m, 1,220m, 1,086w, 1,063m, 1,002w, 967w, 902w, 853w, 806s, 749m, 703s, 625m, 611m, 587w, 543w, 473w.

Preparation of [Co(L)2(4bpy) EtOH)2]∞ (2)

The same procedure as that for 1 was used for this complex except that Zn(NO3)2⋅6H2O was replaced by Co(NO3)2⋅6H2O. Light red single crystals suitable for X-ray analysis appeared at the tube wall after ca. 1 month at room temperature. Yield: ca. 30% based on HL. Anal. Calcd (%) for C44H46N2O6Co: C, 69.7; H, 6.1; N, 3.7; found (%): C, 70.0; H, 6.5; N, 3.5. IR (KBr pellet, cm-1): 3,418s(br), 3,237w, 2,971w, 2,038w, 1,640s, 1,617s, 1,561w, 1,453s, 1,217m, 1,140m, 1,060m, 1031m, 879w, 849m, 822w, 811w, 749w, 612s, 494w.

Preparation of [Ni(L)2(4bpy)(EtOH)2]∞ (3)

The same procedure as that for 1 was used for this complex except that Zn(NO3)2⋅6H2O was replaced by Ni(Ac)2⋅4H2O. Green single crystals suitable for X-ray analysis appeared at the tube wall after ca. 1 month at room temperature Yield: ca. 40% based on HL. Anal. Calcd (%) for C44H46N2O6Ni: C, 69.8; H, 6.1; N, 3.7; found (%): C, 70.0; H, 6.4; N, 3.4. IR (KBr pellet, cm-1): 3,472s(br), 3,237w, 2,511w, 2,038w, 1,688w, 1,640s, 1,618s, 1,564w, 1,456s, 1,132m, 1,029w, 879w, 848m, 816w, 617s.

Preparation of [Cu(L)2(4bpy)(H2O)]∞ (4)

The same procedure as that for 1 was used for this complex except that Zn(NO3)2⋅6H2O was replaced by CuSO4⋅5H2O. Light blue single crystals suitable for X-ray analysis appeared at the tube wall after ca. 1 month at room temperature. Yield: ca. 30% based on HL. Anal. Calcd (%) for C40H36N2O5Cu: C, 69.9; H, 5.3; N, 4.1; found (%): C, 69.7; H, 5.5; N, 4.4. IR (KBr pellet, cm-1): 3,464s(br), 1,604s, 1,450s, 1,402s, 1,303w, 1,221m, 1,151m, 1,066m, 1,032m, 971w, 900w, 879w, 849m, 810m, 756w, 734w, 705w, 691m, 609m, 483w.
